definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: 65—Look at the fellow in the tall silk.
sentences.chinese: 瞧那个戴大礼帽的家伙。

sentences.english: The top hat is for formal occasions.
sentences.chinese: 这种高顶礼帽只有在正式场合才能戴。

sentences.english: It was like owning your private carriage and having a coachman who wore a silk hat.
sentences.chinese: 就像你拥有了一辆私人马车，就连车夫都戴着大礼帽。
伦敦的许多商人戴常礼帽。

sentences.english: Beautiful performances to magic. But you do not have to wear black high-top hat, put on coat.
sentences.chinese: 而且你也不一定要戴上高顶黑色大礼帽，穿上燕尾服。

sentences.english: He's wearing a yellow T-shirt and a brown hat.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着一件黄色T恤，戴着一顶棕色礼帽。

sentences.english: I 'd like to have a bowler hat.
Snuggle down in cosseted support on our Mattress Topper.
sentences.chinese: 依偎在了我们的床垫礼帽娇生惯养的支持。

sentences.english: This top hat is for formal occasions.
sentences.chinese: 这顶高顶丝质礼帽是正式场合用的。

sentences.english: She wore a black top-hat on her head.
sentences.chinese: 她的头上戴着一顶黑色的高顶礼帽。

sentences.english: He can't sing for tall hats.
sentences.chinese: 他不能专为戴大礼帽的演唱。

sentences.english: He wore a derby hat and a black overcoat buttoned across the chest.
sentences.chinese: 他戴一顶常礼帽，穿一件单排扣的黑大衣。

sentences.english: 'Abracadabra, ' said the conjuror as he pulled the rabbit from the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师口中念念有词，把兔子从礼帽中掏了出来。

sentences.english: A word of advice: Ascot requires top hat.
sentences.chinese: 一个小建议，阿斯科特赛马会要求戴大礼帽。

definition: Chinese skullcap resembling the skin of half a watermelon
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
